articles.title: Talks between Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK and International Secretary of C.C., CPPS Held
articles.content:
Talks between Vice-Chairman of C.C., WPK and International Secretary of C.C., CPPS Held
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Talks between Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), and Victor Manuel Lucas, member of the Political Bureau and international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the People of Spain (CPPS), took place here on Wednesday.
					 Ri Su Yong informed of the fact that the WPK and the Korean people closely united around Kim Jong Un, chairman of the WPK, were waging vigorous struggle to build a socialist powerful nation and achieve the final victory in the standoff with the U.S., calling for further boosting the friendly relations between the two parties in the idea of independence against imperialism.
					
					 Victor Manuel Lucas said that the Communist Party of the People of Spain expressed sympathy with the statement of Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, and extended solidarity to the WPK and people of the DPRK struggling against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Present at the talks were officials of the Central Committee of the WPK including Vice Department Director Ri Yong Chol and a member of a delegation of the CPPS.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from C.C., CPPS
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from C.C., CPPS
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the People of Spain.
					 The gift was conveyed to Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday by Victor Manuel Lucas, international secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of the People of Spain who is heading the party delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Communist Party of the People of Spain led by Victor Manuel Lucas, international secretary of its Central Committee, and other foreign guests Thursday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 The visitors paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 And they paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 Then they went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Case of Otto Warmbier
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman on Case of Otto Warmbier
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry issued the following press statement on Thursday:
					 Lately, Trump and his clique, for their anti-DPRK propaganda, are again exploiting the death of Otto Warmbier, an American college student who had been under reform through labor for the criminal act he committed against the DPRK and died after returning to the U.S.
					
					 Trump has let out a stream of invective that Warmbier "suffered unbelievable torture" and that "north Korea abducted and tortured him and intentionally caused his death", while the U.S. State Department announced that they were ready to re-list the DPRK as a "state sponsor of terrorism" over the issue of Warmbier.
					
					 The fact that the U.S. is employing even a dead person for the conspiracy campaign to fuel the international atmosphere of putting pressure on the DPRK shows how vile and inveterate the hostility of the U.S. policy-makers towards the DPRK is.
					
					 To make it clear once again, Warmbier was a criminal who was sentenced to reform through labor on March 16, 2016 by the law of the DPRK for the hostile act he committed against the DPRK according to the mission he was given by an anti-DPRK conspiracy organization in the U.S. However, we provided him with sincere medical care on humanitarian grounds in consideration of his failing health until he returned to the U.S.
					
					 The fact that he was never subjected to any form of "torture" was acknowledged without any doubt even by the American doctors who visited and carried out medical examination on Warmbier in the DPRK last June and by those who examined him after his return to the U.S.
					
					 If Trump and the U.S. are truly sorry for the loss of Warmbier, they should repent and apologize for their crime of luring and pushing a student who should be concentrating on his studies into committing criminal acts against the DPRK.
					
					 The reason that the present U.S. administration is viciously condemning the DPRK with the death of Warmbier again is not because of their concern for the "security of the U.S. citizens" as they always advocate. This is only a lame and sordid product of anti-DPRK conspiracy trumped up by Trump to save his "face" which has landed hard and flat on the muddy ground by the heavy blow from the DPRK's hard-line stance after carelessly wagging his tongue.
					
					 What cannot be overlooked is that the riff-raff in the U.S. dared to cast slurs on the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The fact that the old lunatic Trump and his riff-raff slandered the sacred dignity of our supreme leadership, using bogus data full of falsehood and fabrications, only serves to redouble the surging hatred of our army and people towards the U.S. and their will to retaliate thousand-fold.
					
					 The recent developments teach the lesson again that we should never render leniency or any consideration on humanitarian grounds to the U.S., the DPRK's first enemy.
					
					 Trump should ponder over the devastating consequences to be entailed by the anti-DPRK conspiracy and be fully aware that he and his clique shall be held totally responsible for all the undesirable turn of events to be caused by the careless and imprudent remarks that he gabbles on wagging his tongue in and out of his big mouth.
					
					 We will closely monitor the conduct of the U.S.

articles.title: Spokesman of DPRK FM Institute for American Studies on Anti-DPRK Sanctions and Pressure
articles.content:
Spokesman of DPRK FM Institute for American Studies on Anti-DPRK Sanctions and Pressure
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Institute for American Studies of the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Thursday as regards the recent controversy over the absurd claims that sanctions and pressure upon the DPRK are a peaceful and diplomatic solution:
					 The U.S. which is desperately resorting to unprecedented and heinous sanctions to stifle the DPRK and a few countries following it have lately come up with the ridiculous nonsense that tightening sanctions and pressure is the way for the so-called "peaceful" and "diplomatic" solution to issue of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 A few days ago, high-ranking officials of the U.S. administration including the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, Nikki Haley said all options including military option are available but they are giving priority to the diplomatic solution, and their remarks are misleading public opinion as if the sanctions against the DPRK are a "peaceful" and "diplomatic" means.
					
					 Some European countries and a few neighboring countries with no principle are tuning their voice to the claim of U.S. and labeling the sanctions and pressure as a diplomatic means for the solution of the issue of the Korean peninsula. They are trying to justify their despicable acts of taking part in imposing sanctions and pressure on the DPRK as if it was meant for the peaceful solution.
					
					 Political and economic sanctions and pressure to completely obliterate the sovereignty and the rights to existence and development of a sovereign state are hardly any different from the act of military aggression, and it cannot be justified as peaceful and diplomatic acts in any case.
					
					 In order to counter the inveterate hostile policy and nuclear threat of U.S., the DPRK gained access to everything it needed including nuclear weapons. It would be a huge mistake to think the DPRK would do nothing about the heinous sanctions and pressure against it, let alone the threats of aggressive war from the U.S. and other hostile forces.
					
					 The primary mission of our invincible self-defensive military power with the nuclear force that we have developed at a huge cost at its core is to frustrate the military invasion and sanctions and pressure of the U.S. and protect the sovereignty and rights to existence and development of the country.
					
					 We will continue to march forward along the road we have chosen without the slightest deviation and we will respond to anyone who tries to stop us with tougher counteractions.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home from UNGA
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home from UNGA
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK led by Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho returned home Thursday after taking part in the 72nd UN General Assembly.

articles.title: DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Olympic Committee led by Vice-Chairman Son Kwang Ho, who is vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, returned home Thursday after taking part in the 36th meeting of the Olympic Council of Asia and the 5th Asia Indoor and Martial Arts Games held in Turkmenistan.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Representatives and officials of Indonesian, Lao, Cambodian and Vietnamese embassies here visited the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm on Thursday with the 50th founding anniversary of the Association of South East Asian Nations as an occasion.
					 After being briefed on the exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un associated with the farm, the visitors enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the farm which has turned into a thriving orchard.
					
					 Earlier, they toured the International Friendship Exhibition House.

articles.title: Many People of DPRK Volunteer to Join in Army
articles.content:
Many People of DPRK Volunteer to Join in Army
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The citizens in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have turned out in a sacred war for defending the leader and socialism with their unshakable will to wipe out to the last the U.S. imperialists who are running amuck to "totally destroy" the DPRK.
					 According to data available, more than 4.7 youths and students and working citizens across the country volunteered to join or rejoin in the Korean People's Army in a matter of six days after the announcement of the statement of Kim Jong Un, chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission.
					
					 Young people across the country vowed to take the lead in the final battle against the U.S.
					
					 Youths and students held meetings to join or rejoin in the army, writing in their petitions such slogans as "The great brilliant commander issued a thunder-like order to annihilate the enemies," "Let us blow up the U.S. empire of evils with five million nuclear bombs!" and "Let us annihilate all the American lunatics running amuck like tiger moth!" 
					
					 More than 1.79 million youths and students from workplaces and campuses volunteered to join or rejoin in the military service.
					
					 In three days alone after the announcement of the respected Supreme Leader's statement, at least 120 000 working youth in North Phyongan Province and over 97 000 in South Hwanghae Province volunteered to join or rejoin in the army. More young people in the country vow to join or rejoin in the army with each passing day, including those at the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the Pukchang Area Youth Coal Mining Complex and the Chollima Steel Complex. 
					
					 An increasing number of university students vowed to join in the military service, including those of Kim Il Sung University, Ri Su Bok Sunchon University of Chemical Engineering and Hwangnam University of Technology. 
					
					 Even many women from all walks of life volunteered to join or rejoin in the army. The number of them has reached to 1.22 million so far.

articles.title: More Remains of Martyrs Buried at Cemetery
articles.content:
More Remains of Martyrs Buried at Cemetery
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- More remains of martyrs, who devoted their lives to the country's prosperity and national reunification, were buried at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery in Sinmi-ri.
					 Among them are Pyon Yong Rip, former secretary general of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly; Ri Won Gyong, former researcher of the Finance College of Kim Il Sung University; Kim Jong Nam, former researcher of the Korea General Red Cross Hospital; Ho Jong Ho, former researcher of the Academy of Social Sciences, Kim Ryong Jo, former actor of the Korean People's Army April 25 Film Studio; and Kwon Tong Yon, former general of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces.
					
					 Ceremonies of burying their remains took place at the cemetery on Thursday.
					
					 Attending them were officials concerned and bereaved families.
					
					 The participants laid wreaths and bouquets at the graves of those martyrs and observed a moment's silence in memory of them.

articles.title: 44th National Farm Machine Exhibition, Contrivers' Meeting Held
articles.content:
44th National Farm Machine Exhibition, Contrivers' Meeting Held
 Jongju, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 44th National Farm Machine Exhibition and Contrivers' Meeting took place in Jongju City, North Phyongan Province of the DPRK from September 26 to 28.
					 Taking part in the exhibition were officials, scientists, technicians and contrivers in the field of farm machinery in the country.
					
					 On display there were at least 220 farm machines, accessories and farm implements of more than 30 kinds.
					
					 There were judgment and estimation and field test of farm machines, accessories and farm implements.
					
					 The contrivers' meeting discussed such issues to expand the views of the contrivers and technicians on the world-wide trend of the development of farm machines and standardize the farm machines with high efficiency and introduce them in production.

articles.title: Traditional Dishes Competition and Badminton Game Held
articles.content:
Traditional Dishes Competition and Badminton Game Held
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A traditional dishes competition and badminton game of aged people in Pyongyang City took place to mark International Day of Older Persons.
					 Presented to the competition on Tuesday were staple food and meat, fish and vegetable dishes and drinks. Several dishes and drinks such as mung bean pancake, steamed rabbit meat and steamed eel and makkoli (crude liquor) were highly appreciated.
					
					 A badminton game was held on Thursday to draw many spectators. 
					
					 Kim Phyong and Hwang Song Hui took the first place in men's and women's singles in Group A. Ri Yong Son and Kim Ryong Gil and Kim Jong Won and Ri Ki Ok came first in doubles
					
					 Jong Kyu Jin and Kim Hak Sil took the first place in men's and women's singles in Group B. Jon Jong Gil and Choe Chang Dok, Ri Chun Sil and Kim Son Ok in doubles. Jon Jae Il and Ri Chang Suk took the first place in mixed doubles.

articles.title: Natural Soaps Highly Appreciated at International Trade Fair
articles.content:
Natural Soaps Highly Appreciated at International Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is going on at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House in Pyongyang, the DPRK.
					 What catch eyes of visitors are Ryongaksan-trademarked soaps like shampoo, rinse, shower gel, detergent for vessels and powder soap, all of which are made with Ryongaksan spring water and extracts of rose, lemon, clove, lily and ginger.
					
					 Those soaps are functional products good for hair nutrition, skin protection, prevention of discoloration, antibiosis, fiber protection, etc.
					
					 They are produced by the Ryongaksan Soap Factory which was newly built at the foot of picturesque Mt Ryongak last year under the deep care of the Party and the government for improving the people's material and cultural standards.
					
					 The factory is equipped with modern injection presses and other latest facilities for analyzing and checking the quality and hygienic safety of products.
					
					 In an interview with KCNA at the trade fair, Mun Son Mi, a resident in Central District, said:
					
					 I bought lemon-flavored detergents. I have been used this detergent since last year. It gives no harmful effect on skin, so I think this detergent is better than imported ones.

articles.title: Nano-products Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Nano-products Popular in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The State Nanotechnology Bureau of the DPRK has recently developed a number of nano-products.
					 Among them are microelement nano-fertilizer, nano-correction water and water disinfector.
					
					  The microelement nano-fertilizer and nano-correction water were introduced into over 300 units of agricultural sector to be conducive to increasing grain output.
					
					 The nano-fertilizer helps raise the grain output in rice paddies and dry fields fertilized with manures.
					
					 The nano-correction water has an effect of altering ordinary water into the one with low association degree, thus raising crops' resistance to drought and preventing them from damage by salt. And in case of stockbreeding and fish farming, it prevents diseases and raises weight increment. 
					
					 It was also proved very effective in cultivating fruit trees, flowers and mushroom.
					
					 The water disinfector loaded with nano-titanium electrode is of great use in supplying clean water to people at different units like the Munsu Water Park, Ryugyong Health Complex, Changgwang Health Complex, orphanages and homes for the aged.

articles.title: New Koryo Therapies Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Koryo Therapies Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Institute of Koryo Medicine in the DPRK has developed highly effective Koryo therapies.
					 The therapy combining electric cataplasm with Koryo medicines was proved very effective in treating gonarthromeningitis with less pain.
					
					 And the combination of acupuncture, cupping and electrotherapy accelerates the healing of spondylosis and cervical spondylosis.
					
					 Among newly developed therapies are those very efficacious for digestive, circulatory and respiratory diseases.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Sanctions Are Futile: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Sanctions Are Futile: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Having cooked up the unprecedented "sanctions resolution" through UNSC voting machine some days ago, the U.S. is foolish enough to say that the DPRK will not withstand the sanctions.
					 The south Korean puppet forces, keen on the confrontation with the fellow countrymen, are chiming in with their American master's sanctions against the DPRK. They claim that the new UN "sanctions resolution" would be effective in increasing pressure" on the DPRK and that it would "suffer from strong pain".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun in an article Thursday says that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are mistaken if they think that sanctions and pressure will keep the DPRK from attaining the goal of completing the state nuclear force.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 U.S. sanctions against the DPRK have proved futile. Successive U.S. administrations have used anti-DPRK sanctions only to be shamed before the world.
					
					 The politico-military might of the DPRK has rapidly increased and the strategic position of Juche Korea is in the highest stage despite the U.S. frantic sanctions.
					
					 In a nutshell, it is the U.S. that has resorted to ineffective and exhausting moves.
					
					 No matter what desperate efforts the hostile forces make to put sanctions and pressure upon it, the DPRK will direct all energies to attaining the ultimate goal of bolstering up the state nuclear force.
					
					 The U.S. and vassal forces would be well advised to bear in mind that their frantic sanctions contrary to the trend of the times will lead to their final doom.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces "LKP" for Its Treacherous Acts
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces "LKP" for Its Treacherous Acts
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Recently gentries of the "Liberal Korea Party" of south Korea set the relocation of the U.S. tactical nuclear weapons as "something to be discussed within the party", talking about "exercise of the right to self-defense to cope with the north's nuclear weapons" and claiming that "it is necessary to counter nuclear weapons in kind." And they are busy sending a "letter" to Trump, dispatching a "special parliamentary group" to the U.S. and launching a "10 million signature campaign". In particular, traitor Hong Jun Phyo, representative of the party, asserted that if the "relocation of the U.S. tactical nuclear weapons" is not realized, south Korea should "develop nukes of its own accord".
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Thursday says that the "LKP's" moves to introduce the U.S. tactical nuclear weapons can never be allowed as treachery aimed to turn the inviolable land of Korea and its nation into the victims of the U.S. nuclear war.
					
					 Their reckless deeds are a manifestation of the wicked design to get rid of their crisis by rallying the conservatives under the pretext of "security," the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 In order to gratify their greed for power, the gentries of the "LKP" sent a "special parliamentary group" to the U.S. to curry favor with their American master keen to sell more weapons to south Korea, in defiance of protest and denunciation of the people from all walks of life, and begged for the "relocation of tactical nuclear weapons".
					
					 The "LKP" is, indeed, a group of traitors without an equal in the world and a pronoun of shame.
					
					 It is quite natural that south Korean people of all standings are pressing for dissolution of this party, a group of traitors, rejecting its begging for "relocation of tactical nuclear weapons".

articles.title: S. Korean Bodies Call for Averting Nuclear War
articles.content:
S. Korean Bodies Call for Averting Nuclear War
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Thirteen organizations of south Korea, including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Kimchon Citizens Measure Committee against THAAD Deployment held a news conference outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Sept. 25, calling for averting nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, according to the south Korean paper "Nodong and Segye."
					 Speakers at the conference contended that the tension in the peninsula is attributable to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 They said a peace accord should be concluded to prevent the danger of nuclear war.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Blame Trump's Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Blame Trump's Remarks
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo, the Pusan Preparatory Committee for the People's Solidarity for Sovereignty and the Pusan Civil Rights Solidarity held a meeting under the theme of "Trump, shut up" in Pusan Port on September 24.
					 Speakers said that Trump's recent hegemonic remarks against the north fully revealed the U.S. real intention for aggression.
					
					 The participants in the meeting conducted a campaign to denounce the U.S. for bringing the danger of a nuclear war to the Korean Peninsula and wrecking peace.

articles.title: S. Korea: Part-time Teachers Protest against Wage Cut
articles.content:
S. Korea: Part-time Teachers Protest against Wage Cut
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean part-time teachers' union reportedly held a news conference in Seoul on Sept. 26, protesting against a wage cut by the puppet authorities.
					 Speakers recalled that the authorities are trying to slash the part-timers' pay, rejecting the union's proposal for the wage hike.
					
					 They warned that unless the "government" and the education authorities accept the union's proposal, the union would go on a general strike after declaring the rupture of the negotiations.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Slam Trump's Invective against DPRK
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Slam Trump's Invective against DPRK
 Tokyo, September 26 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Sept. 22 made public statements in denunciation of the reckless remarks of an old lunatic Trump at the UNGA who declared he would "totally destroy" the DPRK.
					 Jo Il Yon, chairman of the Tokyo Metropolitan Headquarters of Chongryon, said that upon hearing the statement of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, the officials and compatriots under the headquarters can hardly repress their surging wrath at Trump, who made the most heinous declaration of war against the DPRK and orchestrated the adoption of an illegal anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution ".
					
					 The chairmen expressed the will to make the anti-U.S. standoff at the final stage run through with the battle for devotedly protecting the leader, conduct the patriotic movement in an offensive way and give full play to the united strength of all the officials and compatriots under the headquarters so as to fully discharge the honorable duty for defending the socialist homeland, Chongryon and compatriots, true to the statement of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Pu Yong Uk, chairman of the Osaka Headquarters of Chongryon, scathingly denounced the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" and urged rogue Trump to retract his inhumane remarks at once and bend his knees and make an apology before the Korean people.
					
					 Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, said that all its officials and Korean youth and students in Japan would throw in their lot with the socialist homeland and stand in the van of the struggle to devotedly defending the leader and the homeland and Chongryon.

articles.title: Slovenian Committee of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Formed
articles.content:
Slovenian Committee of Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation Formed
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A Slovenian committee of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation was formed on September 18.
					 Igor Jurisic, chairman of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the above-said committee.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK was marked in different countries.
					 A book exhibition and a film show took place in Belarus and book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Nigeria, Guinea, Thailand, Singapore and Slovenia between August 30 and September 19.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos showing the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also works of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and books and photos introducing the signal achievements made by the Korean army and people in building a socialist power.
					
					 "Arms of Korea" and other Korean films were shown.
					
					 The chief of a science library of P. M. Masherov National University in Vitebsk of Belarus said that they are pleased to hold a DPRK book exhibition marking the 69th anniversary of the DPRK, and hoped that the exhibition would be a good opportunity in deepening friendship between the two peoples.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea stressed that the sky above Korea would be always blue as there are the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and the tremendous nuclear force, no matter how frantically the U.S. may try to stifle the DPRK.

articles.title: Trump's Reckless Remarks Censured Abroad
articles.content:
Trump's Reckless Remarks Censured Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and Nigerian political party and organizations issued statements on Sept. 22 in denunciation of the reckless remarks of Trump who openly declared "total destruction" of the DPRK, daring to hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership.
					 The International Alliance branded the invective of war maniac Trump as a last-ditch howling of impatience due to failure to deter the DPRK from bolstering military capabilities for self-defense.
					
					 The People's Progressive Party of Nigeria rejected his unprecedented invective as an intolerable insult to a sovereign state and a wanton violation of human ethnics and morality.
					
					 The National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, the Group for the Study of the Songun Politics and the Group for Self-Reliance Studies of Nigeria in their joint statement said it is quite natural for the DPRK to take the toughest-ever counteraction as Trump insulted the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and declared "total destruction" of it under the eyes of the world.
					
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association said that in the history of the UN there were exciting denunciations and threatening "recommendations" among countries with differing ideas, social systems and interests, but it has not yet recorded such reckless state leader as Trump who spat out inhumane remarks to totally destroy a legitimate sovereign state.
					
					 It denounced his utterances as disturbance of justice, conscience, peace and security, urging the UN to be faithful to its duty.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong conversa con Victor Manuel Lucas
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong conversa con Victor Manuel Lucas
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 en esta capital las conversaciones entre Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, y Victor Manuel Lucas, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de los Pueblos de Espana. 
					Ri Su Yong anuncio que uniendo monoliticamente en torno a Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el partido y el pueblo coreanos desarrollan la energica lucha por lograr la victoria final en la construccion de la potencia socialista y la confrontacion antiyanqui y se refirio a fortalecer y desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos bajo el ideal de la independencia antiimperialista.
					
					Victor Manuel Lucas subrayo que el Partido Comunista de los Pueblos de Espana expresa simpatia total por la declaracion de Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y envia la solidaridad a la lucha del PTC y el pueblo coreano contra el imperialismo norteamericano.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el subjefe de departamento Ri Yong Chol y otros funcionarios del Comite Central del PTC y la integrante de la delegacion del Partido Comunista de los Pueblos de Espana.

articles.title: Cancilleria coreana denuncia la campana intrigante anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Cancilleria coreana denuncia la campana intrigante anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 28 una declaracion que sigue: 
					En estos dias, los compinches de Trump vuelven a usar en la campana demagogica anti-RPDC el caso del estudiante norteamericano Warmbier, que estaba en la RPDC en el trabajo reeducativo por sus flagrantes crimenes cometidos contra nuestro pais y se murio tras su repatriacion.
					
					Trump chismeo que Warmbier fue "increiblemente torturado" y el "Norte de Corea rapto, torturo y mato intencionalmente a Warmbier". A su vez, el Departamento de Estado norteamericano subrayo que esta bien preparado para redefinir la RPDC como "patrocinador del terrorismo" en cuanto al problema en cuestion.
					
					Los fabricadores de la politica de EE.UU. aprovechan hasta el finado en la campana intrigante para crear el ambiente represivo anti-RPDC en la escala internacional, lo que hace conocer bien cuan arraigada y perversa es su hostilidad al pais socialista.
					
					Volvemos a aclarar que Warmbier es un criminal que fue castigado el 16 de marzo de 2016 a los trabajos reeducativos segun el codigo de la RPDC por haber cometido el acto hostil a la RPDC para cumplir la mision dada por una entidad intrigante anti-RPDC de EE.UU. Sin embargo, tomando en consideracion el estado mal de su salud, le hemos ofrecido las sinceras asistencias medicas desde el punto de vista humanitario, hasta cuando el volvio a su patria.
					
					Los medicos norteamericanos, que realizaron el examen medico sobre Warmbier en junio pasado en nuestro pais, y hasta otros que lo hicieron despues de su regreso a EE.UU. reconocieron exactamente que no hubo en este caso ninguna "tortura".
					
					Si Trump y EE.UU. se sienten dolores sinceros por la muerte de Warmbier, deberan reflexionarse y pedir disculpas por sus delitos de haber instigado a este estudiante, quien debio dedicarse al estudio, a los actos criminales contra la RPDC.
					
					El acto de la actual administracion norteamericana que vuelve a acusarnos perversamente con el tema de Warmbier no es para la "seguridad de los ciudadanos de su pais" de que hablan las autoridades estadounidenses, sino una vil farsa anti-RPDC inventada por Trump, golpeado duro ante la posicion superintransigente de la RPDC debido a su disparate, con el objeto de recuperar a toda costa su "prestigio" caido al suelo.
					
					Lo mas intolerable es que los fulanos y menganos de EE.UU. se atrevieron a insultar hasta la maxima dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					Esta provocacion del viejo loco Trump y una chusma de EE.UU., basada en los datos penetrados de fraudes y embustes, multiplica la enemistad hacia este imperio y la voluntad de venganza de todo el ejercito y pueblo coreanos.
					
					La realidad vuelve a ensenar la leccion de que son un tabu la tolerancia y la consideracion humanitaria para EE.UU., peor pais enemigo.
					
					Trump debe pensar en serio en las consecuencias catastroficas de tal campana intrigante anti-RPDC y tener bien presente que el y sus compinches seran responsables de todas las cosas desagradables que produce su imprudente acto verbal.
					
					Observaremos la conducta posterior de EE.UU.

articles.title: Portavoz de Instituto del MINREX rechaza caracter pacifico y diplomatico de la sancion
articles.content:
Portavoz de Instituto del MINREX rechaza caracter pacifico y diplomatico de la sancion
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Por estos dias, circulan las versiones injustas que describen la sancion y presion anti-RPDC como medida pacifica y diplomatica por la solucion del problema.
					 Al respecto, el portavoz del Instituto para Asuntos Norteamericanos del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio en la entrevista de prensa con la ACNC, concedida hoy, la siguiente respuesta:
					
					  EE.UU., que recurre desesperadamente en las inauditas maniobras perversas de sancion por asfixiar a la RPDC, y algunos paises seguidores presentan en estos dias el sofisma de que el recrudecimiento de la sancion y presion devienen el remedio para revolver de manera "pacifica" y "diplomatica" el problema de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Recientemente, Nikki Haley, embajadora de EE.UU. ante la ONU, y otros altos funcionarios de la administracion norteamericana difunden el criterio de que en cuanto a las medidas de sancion anti-RPDC, ellos dan prioridad por ahora a la solucion diplomatica si bien son posibles todas las opciones, inclusive la solucion militar. Asi enganan a la opinion publica como si la sancion anticoreana fuera uno de los medios "pacificos" y "diplomaticos".
					
					  Al ponerse de acuerdo con tal tono de hablar de EE.UU., los paises europeos y algunos vecinos flojos describen la sancion y presion como medio diplomatico para la solucion del problema de la Peninsula Coreana. Asimismo, tratan de justificar su sucia conducta diciendo que se suman a la campana de sancion y presion para resolver de manera pacifica el problema de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  La sancion y presion en sentido politico y economico, destinadas a acabar con la soberania de un Estado soberano y con su derecho a la supervivencia y al desarrollo, son tan peligrosas como la guerra de agresion militar y no pueden ser justificadas en ningun caso como acto pacifico y diplomatico.
					
					  Seria un gran equivocacion si piensan que la RPDC, que se dispuso de todo lo necesario, inclusive el arma nuclear, frente a la arraigada politica hostil de EE.UU. y su amenaza y chantaje nucleares, se pondria inactiva ante la creciente amenaza de la guerra de agresion de EE.UU. y las fuerzas hostiles y su brutal campana de sancion y presion.
					
					  La primera mision del inagotable poderio militar de la RPDC con las fuerzas armadas nucleares como su eje, preparado a un precio muy caro, es defender la soberania y el derecho a la subsistencia y al desarrollo del Estado frustrando la agresion militar de EE.UU. y su campana de sancion y presion.
					
					  Seguiremos marchando, sin vacilacion alguna, por el camino que hemos escogido y responderemos con acciones mas audaces a quienes traten de bloquearnos.

articles.title: Regresa la delegacion de la RPDC
articles.content:
Regresa la delegacion de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Ri Yong Ho regreso el dia 28 luego de participar en la 72a sesion de la Asamblea General de la ONU.
